meanings.definition: A narrow, elongated region of high land separating the valleys of two adjacent rivers.
meanings.sent1: The interfluve between the two rivers was covered in lush greenery.
meanings.sent2: The hikers crossed the interfluve to reach the other side of the valley.
meanings.sent3: The animals on the interfluve were having a picnic, enjoying the scenic view.
meanings.sent4: The interfluve stood like a natural barrier, keeping the rivers apart.
meanings.sent5: The interfluve was a majestic ridge, rising between the flowing waters.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate by an interfluve.
meanings.sent1: He decided to interfluve the land to create distinct territories.
meanings.sent2: The geologist interfluvied the area to study the different soil compositions.
meanings.sent3: The chef interfluvied the ingredients, keeping the spices separate from the main dish.
meanings.sent4: Her words interfluved the group, causing a divide in opinions.
meanings.sent5: The artist interfluved the colors on the canvas, creating a striking contrast.
